awesome program - thanks for the upload.

Also... you guys need to know the following:

You will need:
A GUITAR
Some means to plug said guitar into your comptuer.
This can be done with USB/Firewire/or a Min-Din into your Line-In on your sound card.

USB/Firewire will mean you need a third party piece of hardware - like POD XT (google it)

Mini-Din is my 8 dollar rat-shack solution used with ASIO 4 ALL driver. It isn't anywhere near as clean and you will run into latency issues - but it was 8 bucks and it works. Its a 1/4"-Mini-Din converter so I can plug my guitar cable into the Line-IN on my computer - then with ASIO 4ALL (or if you have a high end sound card you should have this ASIO driver already) then futz with the driver settings  - and *poof* I have guitar playing through my headphones.
yeah ur right, you need a preamp for the input signal and a good soundcard with nearly no latency, that's all ;)

I use GuitarRig and Amplitube with this:
http://www.roland.com/products/en/UA-1000/index.html
and have 5 guitars, 2 studio mics, and a laptop (synth), all connected to both my MacProp 8core and my PeeCee.  Great box!  And as they just stopped making it the prices are dirt cheap till stock runs out anyway.  It used to be $1000 but I see it now for like $300 and $400 - highly recommended!

BTW, Amplitube is the same kind of software as GuitarRig but has a much richer sound.
